Instrument.name: The Fluxgate Magnetometer (MISCHA) for Vega 2
Instrument.description: The Fluxgate Magnetometer (MISCHA) on Vega 1 and Vega 2 were identical. The two sensors of the MISCHA were mounted on a boom, the single-axis sensor at 1m and the triaxial sensor at 2m from the edge of the solar panel. The dual-sensor system made it possible to determine the stray magnetic field of the spacecraft. The primary objective of the magnetometer experiment was to determine the role of the magnetic field in the interaction between the solar wind and the comet, and to identify the characteristic boundaries of the cometary environment (bow shock,. contact surface, etc.). The MISCHA had a dynamic range of +/- 100 nT with a resolution of 0.05 nT.
